page.title: 02SKERRIES INTERNAL TRANSPORT
page.content:
As this is an{island,}the most common form of transport is small{boats,}34 in all mainly inshore pleasure craft. The commonest length is 18-20 feet. There are some larger and smaller craft. There is one company owned boat, the Boy Jan used for Salmon farming. It is about 35 feet long.
There are 28{bikes}on the isle but very few are used. There are 25{cars most are on their last legs. The most common type of car is a Mini. There are 9{tractors}and 4{vans}used for farming and moving stuff around the } isle.
There are only 2 miles of single track road on Skerries so many places can only be reached on{foot}and this is still one of the most frequently used forms of transport.
